greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers m such that k*m = Sum_{j|m, j < m} sigma(j), where k >= 1 is an integer.
example: The divisors of 10 smaller than 10 are 1, 2 and 5. Since sigma(1) + sigma(2) + sigma(5) = 10, 10 is in the sequence.
results.author: _Giovanni Resta_, Apr 08 2013
ext: a(9)-a(12) and bound on a(13) from _Donovan Johnson_.
